comment: He is an incredible person, might not be the best professor for marketing if you genuinely wish to learn the subject. He only grades on three things at the end of the semester and you are in competition with your classmates for grades as he grades on a curve. Though he is an amazing professor his tests dont match his lax attitude hes cool though.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor, caring, take him and take notes on for the lecture. Easy class

This class had me so nervous with grade uncertainty all semester. You will not know where you stand at all until the end of the class. That being said, professor is nice and lectures are laid-back but I don't think it really gets the point of wanting students to learn instead of memorize things across. Should give papers instead of tests.

Professor Flaim is a really nice guy with a great sense of humor. Showing up to class is a must, as everything from the test will come from examples he talks about and almost nothing from the textbook/PowerPoints will be on exams. No rubrics or study guides at all. This is the only B I've ever gotten in a class, so make of that what you will.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Flaim is hilarious. His class isn't the most organized and all of the relevant content that will be on tests and the project is discussed in class. He makes studying kind of difficult since it's really hard to discern what's important content and what's filler and his use of D2L is minimal. Other than that, great lectures and personality.

Flaim is hands down one of my favorite professors I have ever taken. He brings decades of business experience into his laid-back lectures. He teaches so much about how the world works it'll blow your mind beyond belief. There's a midterm, final, and group project that are all straight forward if you put in the effort. Take him for anything you can!

He uses his personal experiences to grasp further an understanding of the topics he teaches. I'm a marketing major and he is the kind of person I wish to be like when I'm his age. Concepts are mostly pretty easy to grasp, his tests are extremely challenging but he does reflect that with a massive curve to your final grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor Ive ever had. I wasnt interested in marketing before this semester but I changed it from finance because of how much I respected his course. He uses his personal experiences at Coke and his current company to teach the class. Would recommend taking any class he offers. 2 tests and a group project so you really have to work for it.

Mr. Flaim was the best professor/mentor I have ever had at KSU, and that is after the pandemic hit. He was so understanding, yet still had expectations. His content was extremely easy to learn because he truly was great at lectures. Take his class!

By far the best professor I have taken at KSU. He keeps everyone in class engaged by using participation from those in class. He has stayed after to speak with me about my personal career and given great advice from his experience. Although the class is at 8pm I would take any class he offers if you are able to. 10/10 would recommend this guy.

If you prefer organized systems as a learner, this is not the class for you. His expertise and experience don't necessarily translate into practical teaching of the "tricks of the trade". He talks from the slides and examples seem basic and common knowledge. Two exams and a group project that he curves.

If you are a business major, or even if you just need the course. you will regret not taking it with flaim. he's a very real guy, and he cares a lot about this class. he's funny, and it never feels like a lecture. tests are always based on his own words, if you skip you will fail. he curves the tests big time. best professor and class i have had.

Steve is extremely smart. He truly wants you to succeed. Definitely has a non traditional way to grade, but if you go to class and participate, you'll do well. YOU MUST GO TO CLASS. He gives a ton of info in class that can't be fulfilled elsewhere, and his tests are based on examples and discussions in class. I wish he taught more classes.

Professor Flaim is AMAZING! he def knows how to make class fun, he tells a lot of real life stories which make better sense than the book stuff. a lot of cool speakers come in as well. he is very understanding and cool and you will be glad to have him as a professor! final, midterm and group project is all there is and no book is needed!

Flaim is an interesting guy with a lot of real world experience. However, it was very clear that sometimes, he didn't know what he was talking about when it came to the material. That being said, he brought in some cool guests and did not make the class too difficult. I would avoid if grade uncertainty stresses you out.

Great guy with real world experience. He knows what he is talking about. He is unorthodox but in a good way. He made it easy to come to an 8 p.m. class. Group project could use more structure. Would definitely take again.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: So this guy is a solid professor. The only thing you need to do is ATTEND class. If you do not you won't pass, he grades on a curve as well. The bottom third gets a C the middle third gets a B and the top third gets an A. I had him for an 8 at night and he made it not awful with his outrageous stories about Coke. He was Cokes VP of sales as well.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many

comment: This teacher is amazing. He is very experienced and brings great stories to the classroom. You do need to attend class as some of the test will be strictly lecture based which is not on power points. He is very clear with this the first day of class. Participation will help you in the end. You have two test and a group project.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Good teacher, however, clarity on assignments and projects is a problem with this teacher. This issue will impact your grade in some way shape or form. I enojyed his class, but would have done better if the teacher provided more clarity and Tests are not easy. Overall a good experience, but clarity on projects is a problem.

Very nice guy, slightly unorthodox and often supplements his own stories and ideas for the book's.  Going to class is important, especially if you are on the border-line with your grade.  Fair grader and will often grade on effort as much as numbers.  I would recommend him if you can find his class.
